intro: Centella eriantha var. eriantha, commonly known as the narrow-leaf centella, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its small, opposite leaves and clusters of white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or rocky areas. It produces small, elliptical fruits that contain several seeds. This species is noted for its medicinal properties and is sometimes used in traditional herbal remedies.
